sprint_goal: Implement foundational user registration, login, logout, session refresh, and profile viewing.
epic_coverage: Identity & Access Management UI,User Profile Management UI
key_deliverables: User registration flow, secure login with JWT refresh, protected routes, and dynamic public/private profile viewing.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate user registration, login, logout, and viewing another user's public profile.
success_criteria: All IAM and profile viewing user stories (PWEB-US-001, 002, 003, 004) meet their Definition of Done.
risk_factors: Backend API instability (RISK-001), complexity of JWT refresh logic (RISK-003).
mitigation_strategies: Use mock servers for parallel development, assign senior developer to token refresh task.
external_dependencies: Stable GraphQL schema contract from backend team.
integration_windows: Continuous integration with mock server; live API integration target by day 7.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 73 hours completed by day 5.

sprint_goal: Enable users to build out their profiles with full CRUD functionality and initiate the core networking loop by sending and managing connection requests.
epic_coverage: User Profile Management UI,Professional Networking UI
key_deliverables: Full CRUD for profile sections (Work Experience, Education, Skills). Ability to send, view, accept, and decline connection requests.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate adding a work experience entry. Show sending a connection request from one user and accepting it as another.
success_criteria: All profile CRUD and networking user stories (PWEB-US-005, 006, 007) meet their Definition of Done.
risk_factors: Backend API stability for multiple new mutations (RISK-001).
mitigation_strategies: Continue use of mock servers; prioritize API contract validation early in the sprint.
external_dependencies: Backend APIs for profile CRUD and connection management.
integration_windows: Integration testing for all new mutations by day 8.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 86 hours completed by day 5.

sprint_goal: Launch content creation with rich posts (text, images, links) and build the foundational real-time notification system.
key_deliverables: Rich post composer. Interactive news feed with like/comment functionality. Real-time notification badge and center.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate creating a post with an image. Show liking and commenting on a post. Trigger an action that shows a real-time notification.
success_criteria: All content and notification stories (PWEB-US-008, 009, 010) meet their Definition of Done.
risk_factors: Complexity of WebSocket integration (RISK-004), backend dependency for real-time events (RISK-001).
mitigation_strategies: Assign senior developer to WebSocket setup. Early integration with backend event sources.
external_dependencies: Backend WebSocket server and content/feed APIs.
integration_windows: WebSocket integration testing by day 5. Feed API integration by day 7.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 78 hours completed by day 5.

sprint_goal: Implement the high-complexity real-time direct messaging feature and ensure the entire application is fully responsive across all major device breakpoints.
key_deliverables: Fully functional real-time messaging page. Application-wide responsive design.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a live chat between two users, including typing indicators. Showcase key pages on mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports.
success_criteria: Messaging and responsiveness stories (PWEB-US-011, 012) meet their Definition of Done.
risk_factors: Performance of virtualized chat window (RISK-004). Complexity of responsive refactoring (RISK-002).
mitigation_strategies: Dedicated spike for virtualization library. Integrate visual regression testing.
integration_windows: Messaging functionality E2E testable by day 8.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 72 hours completed by day 5.

sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance through comprehensive, application-wide auditing and remediation.
key_deliverables: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant application. Automated accessibility tests in CI. Manual screen reader test report.
demo_objectives: Demonstrate a key user flow (e.g., registration) using only a keyboard and screen reader.
success_criteria: Accessibility story (PWEB-US-013) meets its Definition of Done. No critical or serious violations from automated scans.
risk_factors: Remediation effort is larger than estimated (RISK-002). Specialized testing skills required (RISK-006).
mitigation_strategies: Focus on high-impact areas first (forms, modals). Allocate dedicated QA time for manual testing.
burndown_target: Linear burndown with 42 hours completed by day 5.
